data.scheme_name: Interest Subvention Scheme for Micro & Small Enterprises-Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides 5.5% interest subvention on loan sizes ranging from Rs. 5 lakhs to Rs. 500 lakhs for manufacturing and allied services enterprises.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in Manufacturing Enterprises & Manufacturing Allied Service Activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: The unit which has already availed the interest subsidy under any other scheme of Government of Karnataka / Government of India are also not eligible for interest subsidy under this scheme.
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in Manufacturing Enterprises & Manufacturing Allied Service Activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The terms and conditions of loan sanction such as promoters contribution, DER, Security requirement, viability of the project etc., shall be ensured as per the prevailing lending policy of the Corporation. 
  2. The unit which has already availed the interest subsidy under any other scheme of Government of Karnataka / Government of India are also not eligible for interest subsidy under this scheme.
data.context: Government of Karnataka considering the difficulties faced by the Micro and Small enterprises sector in availing institutional credit towards capital investments at reasonable interest rates has introduced an Interest Subsidy / Subvention Scheme for Micro and Small Scale Manufacturing Enterprises (ISS) in the State to be implemented through Karnataka State Financial Corporation(KSFC) during October' 2018. Suitable changes were effected in the scheme as per prevailing economic and industrial scenario in 2020-21.
data.objective: To tackle the difficulties faced by the Micro and Small enterprises in availing institutional credit towards capital investments.
data.description:
1. The effective interest rate to be paid by beneficiary /borrower is the difference of contract rate and interest subvention of 5.5% p.a. reimbursed by Government of Karnataka. 
  2. The minimum loan size is Rs. 5 lakhs.
  3. The maximum loan size is Rs. 500 lakhs.
  4. Rs. 200 lakhs for manufacturing and allied services enterprises towards building, gross block* of plant and machinery directly involved in production. 
  5. The loan/s over and above these limits will carry contract rate of interest.
data.how_to_apply:
Interest rate & Processing fees can be checked at- https://ksfc.karnataka.gov.in/info-2/Interest+Rates++and+Processing+Fees/en

Documents required while availing loan- https://ksfc.karnataka.gov.in/storage/pdf-files/Application%20Form%20Detailes/Checklist_for_enterp_880798015%20(1).pdf 

Bio-data & Net worth details format- https://ksfc.karnataka.gov.in/storage/pdf-files/Application%20Form%20Detailes/networth_890548635.pdf 

Project Profile Format- https://ksfc.karnataka.gov.in/storage/pdf-files/Application%20Form%20Detailes/profile_1691157701.pdf 

Application format for term loan- https://ksfc.karnataka.gov.in/storage/pdf-files/Application%20Form%20Detailes/tl_1180195724.pdf
data.funding_mechanism: Visit the nearest branch of the funding facilitator and apply for loan, the loan amount with respective subsidized interest rate shall be provided to applicant.
data.additional_info:
Gross block means the total original purchase / invoice value of all existing machinery used in production activity including self acquired, Bank / KSFC financed etc., plus the proposed machinery within overall limit of Rs.500.00 lakhs as per definition of Small Scale Enterprise in MSMED Act, 2006.

Enterprises/Activities not covered- 

1. Enterprises promoted by SC/ST and Women Entrepreneurs which have availed interest subsidy in any other scheme/s of State Government / Government of India. 

2. Refinancing / takeover of loans from other Bank/s, NBFCs / NSIC/ private financiers and Financial Institutions or for conversion of earlier loans/s available from KSFC. 

3. All infrastructure projects, Kalyana Mantapas, Hotels, Lodges, Restaurants, Guest Houses, Hospitals, Nursing Homes Housing and Commercial buildings / Commercial Real Estate (CRE) etc., 

4. Business / Trading Activities. 

5. Malls, Cinema Houses etc., 

6. Transports Vehicles, Construction equipments etc., 

7. Industrial activities / enterprises not eligible for incentives and concessions as per  annexure-2 of Karnataka Industrial Policy 2020-25 or the subsequent Industrial Policy in force. 

8. Any other activity other than manufacturing which is not specifically mentioned herein.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Annexure-I* (if applicable) 
2. Annexure-II* (if applicable) 
3. Annexure-III* (if applicable) 
4. Copy of Udyam Registration (if applicable) 
5. Copy of the Constitution of the Enterprise (MOA or AOA, as applicable) 
6. Copy of PAN Card of Enterprise & Applicant/Promoters/Directors/partners and authorised signatory (if applicable) 
7. Copy of Caste Certificate (if applicable) 
8. Copy of GST Registration (if applicable) 
9. Other Relevant Documents (if required)
